summary: PhonePe payment prank app clone with in-app notification system featuring message composition with manual recipient name entry, audio recording, notification inbox, and flexible notification sending to any typed recipient name
architectural_notes: Prank/simulation app - no actual payment processing or integration
UI mimics PhonePe success screen design
In-app notification system with no external SMS/push notification services
Browser-based audio recording using Web Audio API for voice messages
Recipient names are manually typed by users instead of selected from registered users
No user registration system required for notification recipients

existing_features.title: Create a payment input form with three fields: receiver name (text input), receiver phone number (text input with numeric validation), and payment amount (numeric input)

Design a PhonePe-style successful payment confirmation screen that displays after form submission, showing the receiver name, phone number, payment amount, transaction timestamp, and a success checkmark animation
Store payment details temporarily in frontend state to allow users to view the success screen and create multiple payment confirmations in the same session
Apply a distinctive visual theme with PhonePe-inspired purple gradients, clean typography, and mobile-first card-based layout that mimics payment app aesthetics
Create a notification composer interface where users can write text messages, select a recipient from registered users, and submit the notification
Implement browser-based audio recording using the Web Audio API that allows users to record short audio clips, preview them, and attach them to notifications
Create a notification inbox interface where users can view received text messages and play back audio messages with playback controls
Add navigation to allow users to switch between the payment prank features and the new notification/messaging features within the app
Replace the recipient selection dropdown in the NotificationComposer component with a manual text input field that allows users to type any recipient name they want
Remove the useUsers hook dependency from the NotificationComposer component since recipient selection no longer requires fetching registered users
Generate a PhonePe-inspired logo image featuring a purple gradient circular icon with a stylized payment symbol or 'P' character, designed to be recognizable and match PhonePe's branding aesthetic
Replace the existing logo in the App.tsx header component with the new PhonePe-inspired logo image, ensuring it displays correctly with appropriate sizing and positioning
Add the new PhonePe-inspired logo to the PaymentSuccess component, displaying it prominently on the payment confirmation screen
Update any other locations throughout the app where a logo or branding image appears to use the new PhonePe-inspired logo, ensuring consistent branding across all screens
Generate a new logo image featuring the Devanagari character 'पे' in white color on a solid purple background, sized appropriately for use as an app logo (suggested dimensions: 200x200 pixels)
Replace the existing logo in the App.tsx header component with the new white 'पे' on purple background logo, maintaining proper sizing and positioning within the header
Replace the logo in the PaymentSuccess component with the new white 'पे' on purple background logo, ensuring it displays prominently on the payment confirmation screen
Update all other locations throughout the app where logos or branding images appear to use the new white 'पे' on purple background logo, ensuring consistent branding across all screens
Update the checkmark tick icon color to green in the PaymentSuccess component while preserving the existing circle background color
